intro: Endlicheria maguireana, commonly known as the Maguire's endlicheria, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped blossoms. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for garden cultivation. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated for its aesthetic appeal in botanical gardens and private collections.
